revision.text: ==English== ===Etymology=== 1634,<ref>{{R:OED}}</ref> from {{m|en|Christianity}}, replacing {{m|en|Christ}} with the abbreviation {{m|en|Xt}} (from {{uder|en|grc|Χ||pos=the letter chi}}, the first letter of {{m|grc|Χριστός||[[Christ]]}} + {{m|en|t}}, the last letter of "Christ"). Compare the more common {{m|en|Xmas}}. ===Noun=== {{en-noun|-}} # {{alternative form of|en|Xianity||abbreviation of {{m|en|Christianity}}}} #* {{quote-book|en|date=December 14, 1950|author=C. S. Lewis|title=Letter to Sheldon Vanauken|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=f3mR0-_rUJQC&pg=PA117|passage=I believe Buddhism to be a simplification of Hinduism and Islam to be a simplification of '''Xtianity'''.}} ====Usage notes==== As with {{m|en|Xmas}} and {{m|en|Xianity}}, as of the late 20th century this term may be considered informal and potentially disrespectful, though it was traditionally an unobjectionable scribal abbreviation. ===References=== <references/> [[Category:en:Atheism]] [[Category:en:Hindutva]]
